rough.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Her hands were rough from hard work.
the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
We were bumping over the rough ground.
rough.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: not exact, not containing many details, or not in a final form
rough.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: a rough sketch of the house
Could you give me a rough idea what time you’ll be home?
a rough estimate of the cost
First do a rough draft of your essay.
rough.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a rough period is one in which you have a lot of problems or difficulties
rough.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The first year was rough, but things have gotten better.
Sounds like you had a rough day.
We’ve been through some rough times together.
My boyfriend and I were going through a rough patch.
The bill is in for a rough ride in the Senate.
It’s been rough going, but we’ve almost finished now.
rough.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Rugby is a very rough sport.
Don’t be too rough – she’s only little.
Paul gave her a rough shake.
equipment capable of withstanding rough treatment
The referee won’t allow any rough stuff (=violent behaviour).
Don’t you think you were a little rough on her?
rough.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a rough area is a place where there is a lot of violence or crime
rough.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The ship went down in rough seas.
rough.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: not sounding soft or gentle, and often rather unpleasant or angry
rough.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: having an unpleasant sound, especially because there is something wrong with a machine
rough.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: The clutch sounds rough – better get it checked.
rough.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: simple and often not very well made
rough.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: The journey was long and rough.
rough.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3: a rough period is one in which you have a lot of problems or difficulties
rough.translation[0].note_box[0].section: He’s had a rough week at work.
My children had a rough time because they were different from the rest.
He was good at encouraging his team when it hit a rough patch.
She was given a rough ride by the press.
Though the president pushed the bill through the House of Representatives, it faces a rough ride in the Senate.
If there is a recession, next year will be very rough going.
rough.translation[0].note_box[1].section: having a surface that is not flat or smooth
rough ground
a rough mountain path
The walls were all rough.
Her hands were rough and work-hardened.
uneven
an uneven  surface has areas that are not flat or not all at the same level
The floor was uneven.
She climbed the uneven steps with great care.
bumpy
a bumpy  road, path, or area of land has a lot of holes and raised parts in it
the bumpy track down to the farm
The field was too bumpy to play football on.
a bumpy journey (=on a road that has a very rough surface)
coarse
having a rough surface that feels slightly hard – used especially about materials such as cloth or wool
coarse woollen blankets
coarse grass
The wool felt rather coarse.
rugged
land that is rugged is very rough and uneven and is often in a high place
the rugged terrain near the mountains
rough.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a picture drawn very quickly, not showing all the details
rough.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a rough of the proposed housing development
rough.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: a rough figure or amount is not exact
rough.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: It is possible to give here only very rough figures.
I can only give you a rough estimate at this stage.
rough.translation[4].definitions[1].exam: a rough draft of the report
rough.translation[4].definitions[2].defi: a rough period, time etc is one in which you have a lot of problems or difficulties
rough.translation[4].definitions[2].exam: It may have a rough time marketing the computers as consumer spending is declining.
The group’s general insurance business has had a rough ride (=a very difficult time) in the last couple of years.
